Package controller

Class login_control

java.lang.Object
helper.callDirectory
controller.login_control
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class login_control extends callDirectory implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class displays the login screen of the application. The text and any error messages will display in either English or French based on the user's default system settings. It implements the Initializable interface and extends the callDirectory class from the helper package
Author:
Zachary Hoppock

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the Login screen of the application, which includes displaying the user's general location/Zone ID in the world.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - a standard parameter when running JavaFX initialization
      resourceBundle - a standard parameter when running JavaFX initialization

    • goToMainMenu

      public void goToMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method takes you directly back to the Main Menu screen of the application if your login is accepted. You will receive an error message if the username and/or password are wrong. Upon correct login, you will be told of as such and also receive a message if your user login has an upcoming appointment or not. Any successful or failed login attempt will be recorded in a separate file.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the Action Event of pressing the Login button in order to change the scene
      Throws:
      IOException - an exception will be thrown if the application is unable to execute the file to change scenes

    • confirmation

      public static void confirmation(String message, String label)
      This method is used to displayed the message of either a successful or failed login.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be displayed upon successful or failed login
      label - the message's label to display at the top based on either successful or fails login

    • upcomingAppointments

      public static void upcomingAppointments()
      This method pulls up a record of a user's upcoming appointments, upon successful login, and advises if there is an appointment within 15 minutes of login with info of which appointment it is. Will simply welcome you in if not so.

    • logUserAttempt

      public static void logUserAttempt(String result, String userInput) throws IOException
      This method opens and writes a login attempt into a separate text file for logging purposes.
      Parameters:
      result - the result message of whether the login was successful or not
      userInput - the username that was entered in and attempted
      Throws:
      IOException - an exception will be thrown if the application is unable to execute the file to write into

    • exitApplication

      public void exitApplication()
      This method will allow you to exit the application if you are logged out.
